intro: Spermacoce procera, commonly known as the tall bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Spermacoce procera is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
